qas.question: Where do African children find their first jobs?
What do African children do primarily while working at home?

answers.text: help their parents run the family farm

qas.question: How many children in Africa are working in the arigucultural sector?
How many children in Africa pick coffee?
How many children work year round in Africa?

context: Children working at a young age has been a consistent theme throughout Africa. Many children began first working in the <a0_0>home<a0_0/> to <a1_0>help their parents run the family farm<a1_0/>. Children in Africa today are often forced into exploitative labour due to family debt and other financial factors, leading to ongoing poverty. Other types of domestic child labour include working in commercial plantations, begging, and other sales such as boot shining. In total, there is an <a2_0>estimated five million<a2_0/> children who are currently working in the field of agriculture which steadily increases during the time of harvest. Along with <a3_0>30 percent<a3_0/> of children who are picking coffee, there are an <a4_0>estimated 25,000<a4_0/> school age children who work year round.
